meanings.definition: One who frolics or engages in playful behavior.
meanings.sent1: The little frolicker ran around the park with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: The children at the party were full of energy, each one a frolicker in their own right.
meanings.sent3: The frolicker's laughter filled the room, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: In a world of seriousness, she was a colorful frolicker, brightening up every gathering.
meanings.sent5: The image of the frolicker skipping through the meadow stayed in their minds for days.

meanings.definition: To play and move about in a cheerful and lively way.
meanings.sent1: The puppies frolicked in the yard, chasing each other happily.
meanings.sent2: The children frolicked on the beach, building sandcastles and splashing in the waves.
meanings.sent3: The kittens frolicked with a ball of yarn, their tiny paws batting it around.
meanings.sent4: The leaves frolicked in the wind, dancing and twirling in the autumn air.
meanings.sent5: The flames of the campfire frolicked, leaping and crackling under the starry sky.
